questions.title: A good way to avoid ID collisions
questions.body:
Hey, I am working on a [ZeroTalk fork](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Hive8oUEeJeheQBLui2zgAxRq7hDasyEW/), making it more Reddit like.

I noticed that it uses sequential ids, but those aren't actually guaranteed to be unique. So I have two comments with the same ID.

I can generate really long, random ones, but I thought I'd ask if there is a better way of doing it. I need those IDs to be unique so I can have replies to comments that point to their parent comments.
